meanings.definition: A mammal of the order Pholidota, having a body covered with horny overlapping scales and a long snout.
meanings.sent1: The manis moved slowly through the forest, its scales glinting in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: I learned about the manis in my science class and found them fascinating creatures.
meanings.sent3: The manis tried to wear a coat made of leaves, thinking it could blend in better with the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as tough as the scales of a manis, never giving up on her goals.
meanings.sent5: The manis's snout twitched as it sniffed the air, searching for ants to eat.

meanings.sent2: Scientists study the manis genus to understand more about the diversity of wildlife.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the manis genus put on a fashion show with their stylish scales.
meanings.sent4: The manis genus symbolizes resilience and adaptability in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent5: Children were excited to see the manis genus up close during their field trip.

meanings.definition: A type of anteater found in Southeast Asia, also known as a scaly anteater.
meanings.sent1: The manis in the zoo curled up into a ball when it felt threatened.
meanings.sent2: Tourists were thrilled to catch a glimpse of the manis during their jungle trek.
meanings.sent3: The manis decided to take up painting, using its scales to create unique patterns.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was as strong as the bond between a mother manis and her offspring.
